newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan money rates end up on fund shortage.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan money rates end up on fund shortage.

text.p: Pakistan's money market rates closed higher on Thursday amid a shortage of funds and dealers said the market might open at similar levels on Friday.
"Yesterday's shortage compelled the overnight market to start trades at around 19.50 percent in the morning," one dealer said.

Most of the day's trades were reported in the narrow band of 19.50 and 20 percent and the market closed at 19.90 percent after banks discounted about four billion rupees from the State (central) Bank of Pakistan.
